name: Blushing Bromeliad
description: Neoregelia carolinae 'Fireball' is a compact, miniature epiphytic bromeliad cultivar native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and features low-growing rosettes (10-30 cm wide, typically 10-15 cm) with medium-sized, dramatic, lance-shaped, dark green leaves with distinctive red to orange coloration in the center, especially when exposed to bright light. The plant displays a rosette growth habit and reaches 10-15 cm in height. Many bromeliads form central water-holding rosettes that create mini ecosystems. Adapted to tropical climates with high humidity, consistent warmth, and filtered light conditions. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds vibrant colors and visual interest with its attractive red-orange center. It's popular among bromeliad enthusiasts for its fire-like coloration and compact size.
careTips: Keep central cup (vase) filled with water
Water soil sparingly - mainly keep cup filled
Remove dead leaves to maintain appearance
